timeline.body:
Since you are stealing a bit, we should do an unsigned shift (`>>>`) instead.

This would never be a problem in practice, but imagine than the length was a 31-bits integer. Shifting by one bit on the left at index time would make this number negative. So here we need an unsigned shift rather than a signed shift that preserves the sign.

timeline.message: Added variously compressible examples of content to tests as per @mikemccand suggestion
Added compression for binary doc values - stores groups of 32 doc values in LZ4 compressed blocks
Optimisation - only write one value if all docs share the same length
Addressing @jpountz review comments - make num docs per chunk part of metadata, remove per-chunk storage of num docs and assume always same number of values. Change doc end pointers to be doc starts.
Added variously compressible examples of content to tests as per @mikemccand suggestion
Addressing review comments. Fields made final, initialise blockAddressesStart in CompressedBinaryBlockWriter constructor, serialise shift for number of docs in block,
